result.execSummary:
All charges against Anthony D. Harris in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony D. Harris is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony D. Harris

records.addlTxt: Order dismissing case with prejudice
Order dismissing case

Defendant Anthony D. Harris in court in custody via video with attorney Stephen M Compton.   DDA Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is on for a review of remedy on detainer issue. Parties have briefed matter. Have reviewed. Parties do not have anything to add. Court addresses parties as to defendant's time in Dane county. Response by DDA Sempf as to transport being legal as believes defense is in agreement. Court cites case law. Further response by DDA Sempf. Argument by Atty Compton and request case be dismissed w/ prejudice and taken back to Illinois. Response by court. Further argument by DDA Sempf and case law cited. Continued discussion on matter of transfer. Court makes record 
Court finds under 976.05 3d, anti shuttle provision, and dismisses case with prejudice. Further record as to if this a Miller issue and addresses state. Court dismisses with prejudice. State to prepare order. Court asks if any further record to be made. Court in recess at 2:57 pm.
Affidavit of Stephen Compton
Affidavit of Anthony Harris
Affidavit of Sean Borkhuis
Defendant's Brief in Support of his Motion to Dismiss
Cour'ts response to Letter from Atty Compton requesting an extension - "Mr. Compton may have until Monday 11-15 to file." PAK

Letter to Judge Koss requesting extension on response
*Mr. Compton may have until Monday 11-15 to file. PAK

Request for Transcription of Recording
State's Letter to Judge on Defendants Motion to Dismiss
Original Warrant filed with the court.
Letter to DCI with signed detainer Form VII
Deft in custody on warrant

4:03pm Court in session 
Defendant Anthony D. Harris in court, in custody via video with attorney Stephen M Compton.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court makes record that matter before the Court is to address the interstate detainer. 
State filed letter, Atty Compton has filed response.
Atty Compton has filed a legal argument on motion to dismiss. 
DDA Sempf has seen the argument & is prepared to proceed. Further argument by DDA Sempf. 
DDA Sempf makes record that Defense withdrew the speedy disposition request. 
DDA Sempf introduces Defendant's request to withdraw speedy trial & email correspondence between Atty Compton & DDA Sempf, he asks that it be marked as exhibit #1. Court receives. 
Response argument by Atty Compton
Court believes the proper detainer paperwork was finally filed & that is how Deft was transported to the Walworth Co. jail. 
Atty Compton is asking that this case be dismissed.
Response by DDA Sempf.
Copy of detainer paperwork provided to Atty Compton to review.
Court reviews detainer paperwork. 
Per statute, trial needs to be held within 120 days of 10/12/2021.
Record by Atty Compton. 
Court makes record. 
Court asks that petition & detainer paperwork be e-filed to Deft's case. 
State is asking for 2 weeks, Atty Compton asking for 1 week after

JT 12-27, 28 & 29
MH 11/19 @ 2:30pm
Deft will remain in custody at Walworth County Jail until trial.


  Motion hearing scheduled for November 19, 2021 at 02:30 pm.
Letter to Judge Koss re: response of DA on 10-12-21
Letter to the Court from the State
DA Service fees          Invoice:21-847             $80.00

Attorney Stephen M Compton appeared.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter was set today for the State to confirm whether the Deft will be transported from IL prison or not. At final pretrial State indicated notes in the file that the Deft would be transported for trial next Monday. Record by DDA Sempf, State will have to go through the interstate detainer process which can take approx. 3 weeks. Atty Compton objects, Court notes objection for the record. Court inquires why the State did not begin the detainer process since March when these trial dates were set. Response by DDA Sepmf that the State wasn't sure if the Deft was actually going to go to trial. Court wants motion hearing on Motion to dismiss added to an off-call calendar. Further record by DDA Sempf. Court wants written letter from both sides 48 hours prior to the motion hearing date. Current trial dates are canceled at this time.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 14, 2021 at 04:00 pm.

Attorney Stephen M Compton appeared.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft in custody at Menard Correctional in IL. Atty Compton spoke to Deft yesterday. Discussion between the parties regarding Deft's Dane Co. case. Discussion between the parties regarding DNA swab. State has notes that Deft can be brought here for trial dates, State to confirm. Court will set status to see if Deft will be transported.

Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared for attorney Stephen M Compton.  J J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2021 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 20, 2021 at 08:30 am.

Transcript filed 10/22/2021
Status conference on March 26, 2021 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Stephen M Compton appeared via phone.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in custody in Illinois. Per Atty Compton defense is withdrawing speedy disposition and requesting trial date be canceled. 
Court would like something in writing as to defendant's request. Response by State. Set over to next week off the call for Atty Compton to touch base with client. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2021 at 11:00 am.
State's Notice of Intention to admit DNA evidence at trial

Attorney Stephen M Compton appeared.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Compton has call scheduled with Deft on 3/16, asks for court date after that date. State notes that case must be heard by 4/5 due to Deft's request for speedy disposition. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2021 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 23, 2021 at 01:15 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 5, 2021 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen M Compton appeared.  Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Compton to set up conference call for next hearing. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for February 26, 2021 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Anthony D. Harris in court via Zoom with attorney Stephen M Compton via Zoom.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person.
Called @ 1:40 pm
Attorney Compton makes a record regarding paperwork for Waiving prelim.
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.
ADA Herrmann will be filing a complaint.
Arraignment - Attorney waives formal reading of charges. Attorney pleas NG to all charges. Reserves Speedy.
Scheduling Order will be e-Filed to the attorney's.


Recess: 1:47 pm
 
  Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2021 at 01:15 pm.

Preliminary hearing on January 29, 2021 at 03:00 pm.

2:10pm Court in session 
Defendant Anthony D. Harris in court, in custody from Menard Correctional with attorney Stephen M Compton.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appear via zoom, no objection by any parties to proceeding via zoom.

State's witness could not be identified in the waiting room of the zoom hearing, Atty Compton requests reset so that he can speak with Deft. No objection from the State as to reset.

2:14pm Court in recess  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2021 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Anthony D. Harris in court, in custody via telephone from Menard Correctional with attorney Kira Leigh Visser in person.  Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 4, 2021 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Anthony D. Harris in court, in custody via telephone from Menard Correctional in IL.  James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft has requested prompt disposition of Interstate Detainer. Deft due to be released from IL in 7 years. Court has colloquy with Deft re: Atty. Clerk to contact SPD to reach out to Deft. State to arrange telephone appearance for next hearing. Warrant remains. Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 16, 2020 at 01:15 pm.
